  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: Nighttime Cold and Flu Original BK000210. The inner receptacle was packaged by the shipper on its side. Improper orientation caused the leak. The SDS was inside the package. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024021821
item.description:
Report X-2024021821

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived at Hazmat cage with signs of damages during the day sort. The contents were inspected and two of the contents showed signs of leakage. One of the plastic bottle caps as missing, and said bottle was empty. The other loose cap was tightened to prevent further leakage. The remaining contents were placed in a lined salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The Failure of the package was due to lose caps, with one cap missing. Together with the empty bottle, approximately 1/8 of the contents from another bottle leaked out. No holes or punctures were found. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: All lose caps were tightened and contents were placed in lined salvage drum to prevent further damages.

DescribePack: 1 2.5 LITER CONTAINER OF RAPACIDE PART B HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF PRODUCT. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, SECURED, REPACKED AND IS AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024021812
item.description:
Report X-2024021812

  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: There are four 4 Liter glass bottles of Acetonitrile inside a fiberboard box. One of the glass bottles broke causing the acetonitrile to leak throughout the bottom of the box. There are wet stains around the outside of the box from the inner leakage. DescribePack: The 4 Liter glass bottle broke. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: hazmat was placed in hazardous material plastic bags and packed inside a yellow salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021866
item.description:
Report X-2024021866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down belt appearing undamaged, but appeared to begin leaking slightly from corners of box after being scanned to truck. Package was isolated from sort and QA called to inspect. Package was then found to be an unlabeled and damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Outer package appears fully undamaged, with no tears/punctures/abrasions, but is leaking paint from corners and edges. 1 item in package is dented, likely via weight of other item inside; outer packaging appears sufficient for items within, but inner packaging and blocking is inadequate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When damage was first suspected, package was removed from the van line and placed into a black non-hazmat bin lined with a plain plastic bag liner. Leak only escaped package after it was brought to van line to be loaded, so was mostly contained within box. Upon inspection, package was found to contain 2 hazmat items, and was moved to a red hazmat bin with plastic hazmat bag liner.

item.title: Report X-2024021134
item.description:
Report X-2024021134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents arrived at hazmat area in fiberboard box inside another plastic container with signs of internal and external damages. The contents were inspected, and one was missing with signs of leakage from two (2) of the three (3) that remain. It was evident that leakage was due to loosen caps. The caps were tightened, and contents were placed in a lined salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The failure of the package was due to loosen caps on of its contents. An estimated amount of 1/4 of two (2) of the remaining three (3) bottles were leaked out. There were no signs of punctures on the bottles. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The loose caps that were found on inspection were tightened, and contents were placed in a lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021488
item.description:
Report X-2024021488

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021488 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO TWO SALVAGE DRUMS. ONE YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM FOR THE THREE GOOD BOTTLES AND ONE SMALL WHITE SALVAGE DRUM FOR THE ONE BAD BOTTLE THAT LEAKED. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT DUE TO A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP AND APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT FROM THE BOTTLE HAVING THAT LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY HAVING ME COME OVER TO REPACK THE CONTENTS INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. 2. X-2024021493 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MAMAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND THE BOTTOM CLOSURE WAS COMING OFF A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. THE TWO BROKEN AND LEAKING BOTTLES WERE PACKED SEPERATELY FROM THE TWO GOOD BOTTLES. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS LEAKED OUT DUE TO LOOSE CAPS FROM TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES. WAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING ONE CUP TO LEAK OUT OF EACH OF THOSE TWO BOTTLES MAKING A TOTAL OF 2 CUPS OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT FROM THE LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK THE CONTENTS INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.
